text: [Music]
English for professionals lesson 3 work
style let's begin with a quick check
what does work style refer to where you
work how you work or what you do at work
the answer is B work style refers to how
you work best your work style
preferences might include working on a
team or being in a leadership position
another person's work style might
include being independent and they might
prefer not to have a routine but rather
a lot of creativity and flexibility in
this lesson let's learn these five words
and expressions work style work ethic
work ethics proactive fall into the trap
of doing something
[Music]
listening practice one listen and try to
understand the highlighted words
like many of you I was influenced by the
people who raised me my parents and my
grandparents because of them I developed
a strong work ethic don't get me wrong I
do take some days off and I tried to
relax even on a busy work day but in
general I tried to avoid being lazy
having a job to do and doing it well
makes me feel good I learned other
values for my family values like honesty
and responsibility and I tried to carry
these values into my professional life
my work ethics haven't changed much over
the years
I believe in finishing what I've started
being responsible for any tools given to
me keeping my promises and working to
the best of my ability sometimes I fall
into the trap of taking on too much and
doing too much work can mean not taking
care of myself I think the key is to
balance initiative and good judgment
what kind of worker are you are you
proactive or do you wait for
instructions to be given do you try to
avoid laziness or do you like to take it
easy
do you work better alone or on a team
tell me about your work style do your
preferences include having a routine or
do you prefer a lot of flexibility
personally I prefer to work alone but I
also enjoyed the creativity of a strong
team and although a schedule helps give
organization to my work I appreciate a
good amount of flexibility in any
project hopefully by the end of this
lesson you'll feel more comfortable and
confident describing the kind of worker
you are during that first listening you
may not have understood every word I
said but hopefully you understood these
five words and expressions
let's review now and confirm your
understanding work style what is your
work style your work style is your
approach to work how you work best your
preferences as a worker here's the
definition once more note that sometimes
you might see or hear working style but
I feel it's more common to say simply
work style an employer or interviewer
might ask what's your work style
describe your work style as a
professional you should be able to
identify your work style preferences
work ethic do you have a strong work
ethic
work ethic is a belief a philosophy it's
a belief that work has value and that
doing work builds character note how we
commonly use this word a person can have
word develop a strong work ethic
in contrast a person can have a weak or
poor work ethic
do you and your coworkers maintain the
same work ethics ethics are values work
ethics are the values that people follow
in the workplace it's a way of behaving
based on a set of values primarily a
sense of responsibility and honesty pay
careful attention to the difference in
meaning between work ethic and work
ethics by using the plural we have a new
meaning work ethics are sometimes also
referred to as workplace ethics and we
can talk about following work ethics
following good work ethics
active are you a proactive worker
Proactive is taking the initiative not
waiting for others to tell you what to
do
note that proactive is an adjective we
often talk about being proactive and we
can mention a proactive approach or
discuss a proactive worker
fall into the trap of doing something
does that sound like a good thing or a
bad thing well trap is not good so if
you fall into the trap of doing
something we're talking about doing an
action although it's not wise to do it
so it's a case of bad judgment or
perhaps a bad habit here's the
definition once more and in this
definition I note that sometimes we use
this expression with repetitive actions
something you do more than once again
although you know it's not wise to do
you end up doing it several times over
again look how we commonly use this we
say I fell into the trap of doing
something or we warned someone don't
fall into the trap of doing what the
grammar requires a gerund of doing
something listen a second time to the
opening talk try to focus on the details
like many of you I was influenced by the
people who raised me my parents and my
grandparents because of them I developed
a strong work ethic don't get me wrong I
do take some days off and I tried to
relax even on a busy work day but in
general I try to avoid being lazy having
a job to do and doing it well makes me
feel good I learned other values for my
family values like honesty and
responsibility and I tried to carry
these values into my professional life
my work ethics haven't changed much over
the years
I believe in finishing what I've started
being responsible for any tools given to
me keeping my promises and working to
the best of my ability sometimes I fall
into the trap of taking on too much and
doing too much work can mean not taking
care of myself I think the key is to
balance initiative and good judgment
what kind of worker are you are you
proactive or do you wait for
instructions to be given do you try to
avoid laziness or do you like to take it
easy
do you work better alone or on a team
tell me about your work style do your
preferences include having a routine or
do you prefer a lot of flexibility
personally I prefer to work alone but I
also enjoyed the creativity of a strong
team and although a schedule helps give
organization to my work I appreciate a
good amount of flexibility
in any project hopefully by the end of
this lesson you'll feel more comfortable
and confident describing the kind of
worker you are
now to check your understanding I'd like
you to answer four true/false questions
one according to the video Jennifer
developed a strong work ethic at school
true or false
the answer is false I developed it at
home thanks to my parents and
grandparents to Jennifer's values in the
workplace have changed significantly
over the years is this true or false
this is false I said that my work ethics
haven't changed much over the years
three in Jennifer's opinion working hard
has some dangers true or false this is
actually true if you recall I said that
sometimes I take on too much and doing
too much work can mean not taking care
of oneself for Jennifer's work style
preferences include working
independently is that true or false this
is true I mentioned I do enjoy working
on a creative team but overall I prefer
working independently
this is the end of part 1 before you go
on to part 2 please note that additional
practice is available at English cafe
comm follow the direct link listed in
the video description and then I'll see
you back here for part 2
